question: (Kelly of the Clue Crew reports from Haleakala Observatory in Maui, Hawaii.)  The unit here fires pulses of light at mirrors on the moon & man-made satellites; the pulses reflect back to earth, allowing distances to be precisely measured; it's called an LRS, this type of ranging system
